meanings.definition: To fit or adjust something to a previous state or condition.
meanings.sent1: She spent the afternoon backfitting the old dress to fit her younger sister.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic backfitted the engine to its original specifications.
meanings.sent3: The tailor joked that he was a backfitting expert, turning old clothes into new ones.
meanings.sent4: He backfitted his outdated phone with the latest technology, making it like new.
meanings.sent5: Backfitting the puzzle pieces together, she completed the picture perfectly.

meanings.definition: The act of modifying or adjusting something to match a previous standard or requirement.
meanings.sent1: The backfitting of the software was necessary to ensure compatibility with the old system.
meanings.sent2: Her backfitting of the recipe made it suitable for the dietary restrictions.
meanings.sent3: The backfitting of the costume for the play turned out to be a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: The backfitting of the house with modern amenities increased its value.
meanings.sent5: The backfitting of the car with new safety features made it more reliable.
